text: The 2006 UEFA European Under-17 Championship was the fifth edition of UEFA's European Under-17 Football Championship. Luxembourg hosted the championship, during May 3–14. Russia defeated the Czech Republic in the final to win the competition for the second time. Players born after 1 January 1989 could participate in this competition. ==Squads== Is for 17 and younger normally Between late May to early June ==Qualifying== There were two qualifying rounds. * * ==Teams== (host) == Match Officials == A total of 6 referees, 8 assistant referees and 2 fourth officials were appointed for the final tournament. ;Referees * William Collum * Thomas Einwaller *
